newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Portuguese bonds end weaker, pressured by dlr.
newsitem.headline: Portuguese bonds end weaker, pressured by dlr.

text.p: 1624 GMT - Portuguese bonds ended weaker as the stronger dollar weighed on Bunds and peripheral markets.
*Spread vs 10-yr cash Bund 69 bps vs 68 bps
Portuguese bonds ended weaker in sympathy with Bunds and peripheral markets, pressured by a stronger dollar, and dealers said the trend could continue tomorrow.
"The dollar, stronger and stronger, is punishing Bunds, and the peripherals are following the slide in Bunds," one operator said.
Another said: "The exchange rate question will be key tomorrow. If the dollar continues to show strength, we will see a weakened Bund, dragging down Bonos and Portuguese bonds."
